meanings.definition: A person who engages in fraudulent or dishonest practices.
meanings.sent1: The scam artist turned out to be the scummier in the group.
meanings.sent2: The scummier was finally caught by the authorities for his illegal activities.
meanings.sent3: The scummier tried to sell fake watches at the flea market but got caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the scummier lurking around, ready to deceive unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The image of the scummier's sly smile stayed etched in my mind.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adjective 'scummy', meaning covered in or resembling scum.
meanings.sent1: The pond water looked even scummier after the rainstorm.
meanings.sent2: The old, abandoned house had a scummier appearance than the rest of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The scummier film on the surface of the soup made it unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The scummier layer of dust on the shelves indicated neglect and lack of cleaning.
meanings.sent5: The scummier texture of the algae made it slippery to walk on.
